sn13.2:1.2: “Mendicants, suppose there was a lotus pond that was fifty leagues long, fifty leagues wide, and fifty leagues deep, full to the brim so a crow could drink from it.
sn13.2:1.3: Then a person would pick up some water on the tip of a blade of grass.
sn13.2:1.5: Which is more: the water on the tip of the blade of grass, or the water in the lotus pond?”
sn13.2:2.1: “Sir, the water in the lotus pond is certainly more.
sn13.2:2.2: The water on the tip of a blade of grass is tiny.
sn13.2:2.3: Compared to the water in the lotus pond, it’s not nearly a hundredth, a thousandth, or a hundred thousandth part.”
sn13.2:3.1: “In the same way, for an individual with comprehension, a noble disciple accomplished in view, the suffering that’s over and done with is more, what’s left is tiny.
sn13.2:3.2: Compared to the mass of suffering in the past that’s over and done with, it’s not nearly a hundredth, a thousandth, or a hundred thousandth part, since there are at most seven more lives.
sn13.2:3.3: That’s how very beneficial it is to comprehend the teaching and gain the vision of the teaching.”
